meanings.definition: Make sensitive or aware to a particular stimulus or situation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is sensitizing the students to the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise sensitizing the dog to hide under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The cat is sensitizing the owner by pretending to be stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds sensitizing the town to the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies sensitizing everyone's taste buds.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone or something) to respond to certain stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The therapist is sensitizing the patient to overcome their fear of heights.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock sensitizing me to wake up early every morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey sensitizing the zoo visitors by stealing their hats.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker sensitizing the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting sensitizing emotions in the viewers.
